data.title: List of 1950s Spanish
data.meta_description: The list "1950s Spanish-language films" has been viewed 0 times.
data.text:
Desert Warrior 1957 film

0 0

Genre: Adventure

Prince Saïd escapes his father's murderers, sent by traitor Ibrahim who quickly takes over the throne. Becoming a desert bandit he fights to get back his ... more »

rank #1 · 11

Desert Warrior (Italian: Gli amanti del deserto, Spanish: Los amantes del desierto) is a 1957 Italian-Spanish adventure film directed by Goffredo Alessandrini, Fernando Cerchio, León Klimovsky and Gianni Vernuccio and starring Carmen Sevilla, Ricardo Montalbán and Gino Cervi.

Films scored by Michel Michelet · 40T

1957 adventure films · 17T

Films directed by Gianni Vernuccio · 3T

La violetera 1958 film

0 0

Genre: Romance, Musical, Drama

On New Year's Eve 1899, Soledad is peddling violets in a Madrid busy street when she meets aristocrat Fernando... more »

rank #2 · 186 1

The Violet Seller, better known under its Spanish title La Violetera, is a 1958 Spanish-Italian historical musical film produced by Benito Perojo, directed by Luis César Amadori and starring Sara Montiel, Raf Vallone, Frank Villard, Tomás Blanco and Ana Mariscal.

Spanish historical musical films · 12T

1950s historical musical films · 47T

Italian historical musical films · 24T

El tigre enmascarado 1951 Mexican film

0 0

Aspiring opera singer Luis Landa returns to his hometown to avenge the murder of his brother. more »

rank #4 ·

The Masked Tiger (Spanish:El tigre enmascarado) is a 1951 Mexican western film directed by Zacarías Gómez Urquiza and starring Luis Aguilar, Flor Silvestre and Aurora Segura.

1951 Western (genre) films · 104T

Films directed by Zacarías Gómez Urquiza · 10T

Mexican black-and-white films · 656T

El enamorado 1952 Mexican film

0 0

Genre: Western, Drama, Comedy

Director: Miguel Zacarías

rank #6 · 18

The Lover (Spanish: El Enamorado, alternately known as Vuelve Martin Corona) is a 1952 Mexican comedy western film directed by Miguel Zacarías and starring Pedro Infante, Sara Montiel and Eulalio González. It is a sequel to Here Comes Martin Corona.

Corazón salvaje 1956 film

0 0

Genre: Drama

rank #7 · 1 1

Corazón salvaje is a 1956 Mexican drama film directed by Juan José Ortega and starring Martha Roth, Christiane Martel, Carlos Navarro and Rafael Bertrand. It was the first screen adaptation of the novel of the same name written by Caridad Bravo Adams and published in 1957, a year after the film adaptation was released. The first adaptation was made as a radionovela.

1956 drama films · 235T

Films based on Mexican novels · 14T

Mexican drama films · 481T

Caballero a la medida 1954 film by Miguel M. Delgado

0 0

Genre: Comedy

Cantinflas works as a model of tuxedos for a prestigious store. He just has to wander around in the streets... more »

rank #8 ·

A Tailored Gentleman (Spanish: Caballero a la medida) is a 1954 Mexican comedy film, directed by Miguel M. Delgado and starring Cantinflas, Martha Valdés and Ángel Garasa. The film's art direction was by Gunther Gerszo.

1954 comedy films · 173T

Mexican comedy films · 272T

Films directed by Miguel M. Delgado · 46T

0 0

Genre: Drama, Crime, Comedy

Director: Luis Buñuel

The delirious journey of a mental disordered man, who is obsessed in making the perfect crime. more »

rank #9 · 25 1

The Criminal Life of Archibaldo de la Cruz (original Spanish title: Ensayo de un crimen, "Rehearsal for a Violent Crime") is a 1955 Mexican film by Spanish-born writer-director Luis Buñuel. It focuses on a would-be serial killer whose plans, although elaborate, never result in an actual murder.

Mexican black comedy films · 3T

Mexican crime comedy films · 5T

1955 comedy films · 180T
